title: Trump Administration reviews 55 million US visa holders for deportation violations
byline: The State Department said Thursday that it’s reviewing the records of more than 55 million foreigners who hold valid U.S. visas for potential revocation or deportable violations of immigration rules.

title: Evening thundershowers expected in several provinces today
byline: Atmospheric conditions are favorable for evening thundershowers in the Northern, North-Central, Central, Uva and Eastern provinces during the next few days, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Ex-President Ranil summoned to CID today
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has been summoned to appear at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today (22).

title: Former President Ranil arrives at CID
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this morning (22) to provide a statement in connection with an ongoing investigation.

title: Earthquake of magnitude 7.5 hits Drake Passage off South America
byline: A magnitude 7.5 earthquake struck the Drake Passage on Thursday, the waters between South America’s southern tip and Antarctica.

title: Postal workers on strike will not receive salaries – Postmaster General
byline: Postmaster General Ruwan Sathkumara announced that postal employees currently engaged in strike action will not be paid their salaries for this month.

title: Suspect killed in shootout with STF at Sooriyawewa
byline: A suspect has been shot dead during a shootout at Wewegama in Sooriyawewa, when Police Special Task Force (STF) personnel attempted to arrest him.

title: Police protection for Colombo Central Mail Exchange as strike continues
byline: The strike action initiated by the postal trade unions continues for the fifth consecutive day today (22).

title: Bandaragama shooting victim was a former prison officer - Police
byline: Police have revealed further details regarding the shooting incident near the Bolgoda Bridge in the Bandaragama Police Division last evening and the victim of the shooting.

title: Israel’s defense minister warns Gaza City could be destroyed
byline: Israel’s defense minister warned on Friday that Gaza City could be destroyed unless Hamas accepts Israel’s terms, as the country prepares for an expanded offensive in the area.

title: Ex-Minister Akila Viraj arrives at Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister Akila Viraj Kariyawasam has arrived at the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) this morning (22) to provide a statement.

title: Draft bill to repeal PTA to be gazetted next month - Foreign Minister
byline: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath informed Parliament today (22) that the draft bill to repeal the controversial Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) will be published in the Government Gazette in the beginning of September.

title: Lil Nas X arrested and taken to hospital after wandering LA streets in underwear
byline: Award-winning rapper Lil Nas X has been arrested after an altercation with police in Los Angeles, authorities have confirmed.

title: Postal trade unions stage ‘Satyagraha’ in Colombo
byline: Postal trade unions participating in the ongoing strike have staged a ‘Satyagraha’ campaign in front of the Colombo Central Mail Exchange, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: UNP releases Ranil’s invitation letter in response to allegations over UK trip
byline: The United National Party’s (UNP) media unit has released a copy of the officially invitation letter sent by the University of Wolverhampton to former President Ranil Wickremesinghe and his wife, Professor Maithree Wickremesinghe.

title: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe arrested
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Ex-President Ranil brought to court after arrest
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), has been brought to the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court, a short while ago.
